website_summaries.verdict: Fun for kids and teenagers, this variant on the classic “Trouble” game adds little other than a Harry Potter theme.
pros: Gameplay is exciting once it gets going – players must roll a 6 in order to start
Rules are simple enough for kids yet complex enough for teens to enjoy
cons: Gameboard is cheaply made, and the “pop” bubble scratches easily
Takes more time to play than one might think

customer_reviews.title: Not challenging or exciting enough
customer_reviews.text: Game is nicely made and it is an interesting idea to have the flipping game board. But there isn't much to the actual play. It'd be best for Harry Potter fans who are younger as it's not complicated. My child is 7 but we play board games often and so his skill set for them is more that of a 10 year old. We will play it but it won't be a favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Garnet79

customer_reviews.title: Accio, Awesome Game!!! Buy this!! ❤
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this because we like the game Trouble and we love HARRY Potter. The game was also inexpensive. We weren't really expecting it to be much different than Trouble, but it is WAY more fun, without being complicated at al!! Great addition to family games!! Easy enough for the youngsters while still being fun for adults! 😁❤
customer_reviews.author: glosh22

customer_reviews.title: Quick, simple, up and running first time through
customer_reviews.text: Note: that we buy a lot of games, my wife might say too many. Up front, this is not a complicated game. However, that does not mean it was not fun. Anything that brings the family together is worth it. If you are looking for a highly complex game you will be disappointed. The more players the more fun, but can be played with two. I cannot speak to the long life of moving board. My seven year old loved it, and keeps asking to play. I do see a few house rules being needed over time. Well worth the $13 price.
customer_reviews.author: RDemeule

customer_reviews.title: Good game
customer_reviews.text: has a little 'tilt' and addition from the regular game that has had so many different motifs made. The cards are an interesting addition... reminds me of having the chance/community chest cards in monopoly! grandson loves it... and he loves harry potter!
customer_reviews.author: C. Chandler

customer_reviews.title: The quality could be a bit better, but it's a great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I grew up playing Trouble on a weekly basis. My mother still loves the game. We're also HUGE Harry Potter fans, so when I saw this...I knew this would make a fantastic present for her. I gave it to her the day before our family vacation. She loved it so much that she brought it along and we all played it multiple times in our condo! The twist of the added "action cards" is really fun, causing tons of laughter and Oh no!s. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kendall B.Top Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Great fun game and a new favorite at our house
customer_reviews.text: Great fun game and a new favorite at our house. The game board is very cheaply made the cardboard insert on the bottom has came loose after just a few plays and had to be taped back into place, the pop bubble gets scratched very easily from the inside from the dice (like old trouble games did with the soft plastic).
customer_reviews.author: Yoduh

customer_reviews.title: The BEST game for kids
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those Pop-it type games where you press the plastic bubble in the middle and it rolls the dice. HUGE attraction for kids! They just want to pop that thing all day! Add in Harry Potter theme and you've got a game that kids just can't resist. My nieces and nephew are addicted (ages 8-9) and they want to play it ALL the time. A great purchase - well worth the buy!
customer_reviews.author: Bookapotamus

customer_reviews.title: Cheap fun!
customer_reviews.text: This game is extremely fun! We have already played it a few times with friends. The cards really do add a nice touch to the classic game of Trouble. It's technically Harry Potter themed, but it doesn't really affect gameplay much other than the cards being themed and the board having HP characters on it. The game itself is extremely cheaply/poorly made, and the actual value is probably more like $5 than the $10 we paid. However, the laughs were so worth it that I would absolutely buy it again or even recommend it to other people. It just should probably be considered somewhat disposable, especially if you're playing with kids or people who can't be gentle.
customer_reviews.author: Emilie

customer_reviews.title: Fun kids game!
customer_reviews.text: Was worried about purchasing this item related to reading some bad reviews.. this game came in good condition- packaging was not damaged, and no game pieces were missing. Purchased this as a Christmas gift for my 5 year old son who is obsessed with Harry Potter and board games. This has quickly become one of our favorite games to play. We have Trouble and Sorry, and this game is kind of like a mix of the two because you have the pop bubble with a die in it, and you also have draw cards that add a little interest to the game. I would recommend this game to anyone with young children who like games and Harry Potter.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsi

customer_reviews.title: Good for a easy game
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old loves it. Very easy game with not a lot of strategy to it. Goes pretty quick. Doesn't have a lot to do with Harry Potter other than being the decoration for the board. So if you're looking for something easy, this is a good game to play.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Simple Harry Potter game for 3 players
customer_reviews.text: In my experience, this plays like another childhood game with a pop-a-matic random number generator. Cool cards that players draw when they land on a Draw Card spot on the game board, that tie in to Harry Potter books/movies in general. Instructions state that you should be able to have 4 players, but mine was missing one game piece. “4 players x 4 different color game pieces = 16 total.” Mine only has 15 game pieces total, so I can only have 3 players. However I will gladly update my review if/when my missing game piece is provided.
customer_reviews.author: K2

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Unique and interesting game. I like how the board is designed and have never played any other game quite like it. My husband and I played it for the first time the other day and he got really lucky with the clues so the game was over in under 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but very poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the concept of a "trouble" game spinoff in Harry Potter theme. This product was very flimsy and arrived with the popper already not working. We jiggled it back into operation,but it never would have stood up to playing a game. We have a Trouble game that has withstood 20 years of being smacked around, I doubt this would make it for 20 minutes. I returned it. I am surprised JK Rowling approved this as one of her line of toys.
customer_reviews.author: DCP

customer_reviews.title: This is FUN!
customer_reviews.text: As a Harry Potter fan, I had to get this. As a grandma, I love that I can play it with my grandkids. It is enough fun that I can play it with adults, too.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Winholtz

customer_reviews.title: Mostly happy.
customer_reviews.text: I love this mostly. We all it’s just Trouble in HP form, but the addition of cards makes it a super fun game. My biggest complaint is the overall quality of the bubble. It’s hard to get it to pop sometimes and then it kind of feels like you’re going to break it. I wish it was better made, but I’m Overall very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Janell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Game is fun, my son really enjoys it. He loves Harry Potter
customer_reviews.author: Wendy A

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Product was damaged but shipping box was just fine. Disappointed, was to be an Xmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap version of Trouble
customer_reviews.text: This games plays almost exactly like Trouble with exception to the included cards. The graphic art on the game board and box is nice. The box is flimsy & has a large opening in the front. I hate game boxes like this because the pieces fall out. The pieces to this game feel cheap and the die in the popper is so tiny. It was still fun & a good gift for a young Harry Potter fan.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Mixed reviews on here so hesitated to buy this but my kids love Harry potter and the game is a hit, have played multiple times
customer_reviews.author: MCS+3

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and the only thing Harry Potter about it is the picture!
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for a quality piece that could be played by generations not so with this game. It's cheaply made with flimsy cardboard game board. They missed an opportunity with the cards to add some Harry Potter fun as they nearly say move back 1 space move forward 1 space etc. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Boring - not much to do without HP aside from the photos.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t have much to do with Harry Potter other than the photos. Boring game. I bought for a 6 yr old and he was frustrated and bored - as was I.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine T.

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my sister who is a huge Harry Potter fan. She loved it and has played it many times already since we purchased it. I was expecting it to be of cheap quality but it is actually very well made. I would definitely recommend this product for fans of Harry Potter. It goes great with the Harry Potter playing cards as well.
customer_reviews.author: RMR

customer_reviews.title: Meh! Not sure it's worth it. Maybe, kinda?
customer_reviews.text: We tried playing a couple times. You can't make a move until you roll a six though. So it takes a while to get through the game. It also feels very unfair at times. We'll try the game a few more times. Maybe we're just not getting something. Not sure. Just kinda leaves you feeling 'meh' though.
customer_reviews.author: TeniseRae J.

customer_reviews.title: Fun if you don't use the cards
customer_reviews.text: My kids love Harry Potter and board games so I thought this would be perfect for them. However, it has these cards you draw and follow the directions if you land on a marked space and they are placed about every space and the cards will say move back 2, so you have to draw again and it'll say move up 2 so you have to draw again, etc. It would be better if there wasn't cards or they were spaced farther apart.
customer_reviews.author: L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Don't pay more than $7/8
customer_reviews.text: Fun game of Trouble with a twist. That said, the game board and box are super cheap. The cards are pretty thin and don't have a box; there is also no way to store the game pieces so a couple Ziplocs are required to keeps track of the cards and game pieces. The window in the box is super, super flimsy, which makes the box less useful...
customer_reviews.author: CoolStuff8374

customer_reviews.title: Fun for any Harry Potter fan
customer_reviews.text: Super fun spin on a traditional game, esp for the Harry Potter fan. My 9 and 12 yr olds loved playing it. I even enjoyed playing.
customer_reviews.author: momoftwoboys

customer_reviews.title: Boring for 12 Years Old
customer_reviews.text: HP fan Daughter got for Xmas. 3 HP fans played it and said it’s the most boring game. Player doesn’t get to move unless you roll a Six from the dice which is not very often. Time spent waiting for the six to happen isn’t very entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: ShopperLife

customer_reviews.title: Too simple, no challenge
customer_reviews.text: Not much of a game. Designed for ages 8 to 10. Very simple game, with no challenge. Played 2 games in 20 minutes and don't have any desire to play again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great game for Potter fans
customer_reviews.text: Got this on sale and it's really fun. The board seems sturdy. Easy to play for my 9 and 11 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Archer

customer_reviews.title: this made my Harry Potter loving boys very happy! They have loved having their friends over to ...
customer_reviews.text: There’s not much to this game if you already have Trouble - but for $10, this made my Harry Potter loving boys very happy! They have loved having their friends over to play this game. Overall: worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Stead Family

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: Fun game, just like Trouble. Board is cardboard and plastic, so really cheap, but honestly for the low price it’s fine. Would like to see a more expensive version of this game.
customer_reviews.author: WW47

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: My Harry Potter obsesses daughter loves this! The concept is the same as Trouble so easy to play; my kids have spent many hours playing this since it arrived. Seems a little flimsy but overall a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Stu J

customer_reviews.title: Fun game!
customer_reviews.text: My 9yo daughter and I love to play this! Fun and a bit challenging for her.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Ayer

customer_reviews.title: Brings back childhood memeries
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift so I never got to actually play the game but its very much like Trouble. It made me want to play it AND watch Harry Potter again. They loved it so I totally think this was a successful gift. Definitely would buy again for another Harry Potter and board game lover.
customer_reviews.author: LadiNightshade

customer_reviews.title: Harry Potter games
customer_reviews.text: I bought these Harry Potter games for my grand daughter who is a huge fan of the series. She loved all of them. I have not played any of them with her, so I don't know how easy they are to play. But I'm sure the younger generation will have no problem figuring it out.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Ostrom

customer_reviews.title: Childhood Favorite with a HP twist!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this game as a child and now my children love it too. Makes it better than there is a Harry Potter twist to it! Simple, fun, and entertaining!
customer_reviews.author: Ke44

customer_reviews.title: Actually quite fun even for adults!
customer_reviews.text: Got suckered into playing this with an 6 and 8 year old and before it was over there were other "grown ups" wanting to join in. The bubble dice thrower made it through a week of abuse and continues to work. Literally fun for the entire family!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bummed
customer_reviews.text: It’s great... great value and really fun... but not sturdy and is cheaply made. Every pop of the die cracks the plastic more and more.. going to continue to play until we have to throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler & Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Classic Trouble with a Harry Potter Twist
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this game. It's classic trouble, but Harry Potter themed. There are a few spots on the board where you draw from a deck of cards and it can be a benefit or detriment and makes the game entertaining and gives it a bit more than just a Harry Potter decorated game.
customer_reviews.author: L. Corriveau

customer_reviews.title: This version adds some FUN!!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE a good game of Trouble!! With the Harry Potter version, you can now draw cards to make moves of your own or the cards could change your opponents moves. Super fun!!! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M

customer_reviews.title: Great game for a young HP fan
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this Harry Potter trouble game once for my son and again for his best friend as we have enjoyed playing it. They are not nine & big HP fans too!
customer_reviews.author: Sackfield

customer_reviews.title: Better than the real trouble game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is so much fun! Gift for my 11 year old and she loves it! The cards make it so much more fun!
customer_reviews.author: kristy

customer_reviews.title: Fun game!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Grandson along with Harry Potter Lego's. He is big into anything Harry Potter. I played this game with him a few times & it really was a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Shirl

customer_reviews.title: Keeps kids busy
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas present for my nephew. He loves Harry Potter and plays this game with his sister often.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher& Michelle Whitmore

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Trouble knockoff
customer_reviews.text: It's a really flimsy Trouble game, with a Harry Potter photo on it. Kids like it because Trouble is silly and fun, and for them, the Harry Potter theme is a bonus, but it won't last long with the flimsy quality.
customer_reviews.author: GinOya

customer_reviews.title: Harry Potter Trouble game? Yes please!
customer_reviews.text: I love Harry Potter so why wouldn't I want a Harry Potter themed Trouble game! My only critique would be that the game board could be a little bigger but other than that a classic game for anyone's collection.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Erion

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: This is a cute game. It seems smaller than a regular Trouble game, but I love the ability to have the Harry Potter theme incorporated into it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica K.

customer_reviews.title: Cool, fairly priced game
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this game. I got it for a family member for Christmas. Only thing is... There was a roll of used tape inside the game, stuck to the dice popper. So I had to open it, remove it, and clean off the tape gunk. No biggie.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Vanscoyk

customer_reviews.title: Like it!
customer_reviews.text: Great gift. Only issue is that the card board underneath is detached the plastic game board on one side. Other than that it was a great success with the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute game - good for kids
customer_reviews.text: This is almost exactly Trouble with a small twist thrown in. It was fun, but my hubby and I are avid gamers with no kids and this was a bit simple for us. If you have young kids this game will be awesome!
customer_reviews.author: C. Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Great game. More clear directions would be helpful
customer_reviews.text: Great game. Daughter and friends love it. Tad complicated to learn
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Turtle

customer_reviews.title: Just OK. Kids only played once with it.
customer_reviews.text: Our HP fans were very excited to play this game, they played for 30 minutes and did not seem very enthusiastic after. Never opened the box since. (30 days ago!)
customer_reviews.author: lena cambis

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for granddaughter for Christmas never heard if she liked it or not. I would have loved it. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Maudie Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Fun game at my Halloween party and really was a ...
customer_reviews.text: Fun game at my Halloween party and really was a great activity for all of us We are in our twenties and had a wonderful time with it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: HP spin on classic game.
customer_reviews.text: Harry Potter soon on a classic game. My kids liked it. It was a good gift for fans of Harry Potter.
customer_reviews.author: Artmom27

customer_reviews.title: Nice game if u like that type.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it as a gift. I don’t think they played for yet. But seem to like it very much.
customer_reviews.author: Destiny

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Thank God I bought this on sale. It cracked within 5 minutes of playing. The board is super flimsy plastic
customer_reviews.author: Aasjenkins

customer_reviews.title: Super fun game!
customer_reviews.text: Super fun game with awesome HP facts and quotes built in! Harry Potter fans & others will love this game.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomeR

customer_reviews.title: “Let the Tri-Wizard tournament begin!!”
customer_reviews.text: The Harry Potter version of Sorry with the addition of chance cards. Very fun for a family of all ages.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy construction
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for grandson. Flimsy construction, won't last long. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. The box was all banged up and the game is very cheap looking. Love the Harry Potter theme though.
customer_reviews.author: jodie berry

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: The kids were underwhelmed by this game. It might have been a good time before electronic games. It's getting harder to catch the interest of kids. This is probably good for younger children.
customer_reviews.author: Plumfanatic

customer_reviews.title: Must have for HP fans
customer_reviews.text: Huge HP fans and decided to add this to our geekdom. Super fun and easy to play.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthy J

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old loves Harry Potter and this game! Her and her sister (7) love playing together.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: It is a fun game to play and our family had a lot of fun. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Irina Mason

customer_reviews.title: Fun for my Potterheads
customer_reviews.text: They whole family, even the toddler loves playing this game. The toddler pushes the button to roll the dice for all of us. Great family game night game.
customer_reviews.author: Beequa

customer_reviews.title: Harry’s in Trouble!
customer_reviews.text: Son and his friends loved it. I think my husband may have loved it more though.
customer_reviews.author: C. Green

customer_reviews.title: What I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and well packaged. Great price. This was a gift to a family of game players. Really simple and easy to learn.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Niemi

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Good quality good price Fun game. Gave to 12yr old niece
customer_reviews.author: Razzel

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for my friend who let my kids play her game and they lost a few pieces. Great game to play with all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Jaze Enanoria

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: Fun game for kids, or for family. My Grandsons really enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this game! It is fun and easy to learn. It kind of gets old after a while, but we changed up the game to make it more exciting. Once you get the hang of it, try adding rules such as needing to get more or certain creatures.
customer_reviews.author: Haily

customer_reviews.title: Good gift for Potter lovers
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift and my family seems to enjoy it!
customer_reviews.author: Jameson

customer_reviews.title: Great game with a new twist
customer_reviews.text: The Harry Potter cards make this game much more interesting.
customer_reviews.author: LAF

customer_reviews.title: fun
customer_reviews.text: i didn't buy this for me. it was a birthday present for 2 younger cousins who are 11 and 12. They sure enjoyed the game during family time
customer_reviews.author: Zachary D. Furr

customer_reviews.title: Love Harry Potter
customer_reviews.text: I love all things Harry Potter. Very excited to get and play.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Looks just like the pictures. Fun to play. Perfect for any Harry Potter Fan!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game, it is basically Harry Potter version of trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Di

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: Our Grandsons, ages 5 and 7, enjoy Harry Potter but aren’t ready for some of the more complicated games. Thus has been a fun, family game.
customer_reviews.author: Grraandma

customer_reviews.title: Super fun
customer_reviews.text: Family loved it. It's a mix between trouble and sorry. Design is nice and simplistic. Only con is the bobble in the center doesn't seem the sturdiest, but I haven't had any qualms with it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Shea

customer_reviews.title: Looove it!!!
customer_reviews.text: My son and I looove to play this...he wants to play it constantly!!! For 3 whole days it's all he asked for lol...such a great buy :)
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: My kids and I are playing right now and we love it! It’s easy to learn and really fun!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent packaging and product. My daughter will love this game!
customer_reviews.author: Emma Scott

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Harry Potter lovers
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my friends son and he said it was his favorite Christmas gift! Cool trouble game- Harry Potter style!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Rose Grubbs

customer_reviews.title: Harry potter trouble
customer_reviews.text: Trouble with harry potter theme....what else needs to be said.
customer_reviews.author: AMY HOLDER

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: It was a little confusing on the begining with the rules but once you get use it and have played with it several times then it become even more enjoyable!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: "Trouble" in a Harry Potter context.
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice gift for a birthday girl having a Harry Potter themed party. This seems to be the game "Trouble" in a Harry Potter context.
customer_reviews.author: Ranger Bob

customer_reviews.title: A lot of fun!
customer_reviews.text: It's essentially a Harry Potter version of the game Trouble but with cards that change it up! My family and I had so much fun playing it! Any Harry Potter fan will love this game.
customer_reviews.author: Nicky A.

customer_reviews.title: Game is fun but the box was broken
customer_reviews.text: The game is fun to play. The box it came was broken but I was too late to return it and get another one so we kept it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: I think it looked fun. It was a gift and I haven't heard back from them
customer_reviews.author: The Philbins

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: Great fun fast board game, gets harder with more people love it
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This will be an awesome gift for my sister! She is absolutely obsessed with Harry Potter and had seen this game in a store on vacation for double the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Simple game but fun for the whole family. Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Allyson

customer_reviews.title: Our boys like playing it
customer_reviews.text: Our boys like playing it. It’s basically a modified version of Trouble. Nothing too exciting, but it was only $5. Worth the $5!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah A. Gable

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: Box was damaged... cute idea, great otherwise for HP lovers
customer_reviews.author: Ebony McDaniels

customer_reviews.title: Interesting
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a really interesting concept for a game. It plays better with four people instead of two, but still doable.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Kathryn Martin

customer_reviews.title: It was a hit!
customer_reviews.text: Great spin on an old game. My daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Dae

customer_reviews.title: It's like "Trouble" with an added factor of drawing cards when ...
customer_reviews.text: 6 year-old boy and 2 adults had a blast playing this game. It's like "Trouble" with an added factor of drawing cards when you land on marked places that add an extra component of randomness. Some of the cards give you the opportunity to send one of your opponent's pieces back to start, for example. The Harry Potter theme got him interested in playing. The game lasts long enough to be really satisfying in a one-more-game before bed kind of way. I recommend for a restless kid(s) and adults who are easily bored. If it doesn't last long, well, it was cheaper than a movie for the 3 of us already.
customer_reviews.author: anon.

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE this game
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this game! We spend a lot of time playing and the cards add a really interesting motion to it. I bought for my son of 7, it's really easy for him to play it and he have always a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M. Ojeda Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Good board game for a younger child
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a birthday present for an 8 year old Grandson. We have played the game together with his older brother and all enjoyed the game.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry M Josephson

product_meta.title: Pressman Harry Potter Tri-Wizard Tournament - Capture The Cup Game
product_meta.description: Color:Basic PackMuggles and wizards alike will be enchanted by this magical game! It features fast-action Pop 'N' Race play as you race around the Triwizard hedge maze to capture the Triwizard cup! Be careful - action spaces cause you to draw a card that can help or hurt your chances. For 2-4 players, ages 5 and up.
